==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|t2=瞭|note=瞭 – sense “clear”}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – an image of a baby wrapped in a blanket, with only the head visible. Compare with {{zh-l|*子}}, where the arms are visible.

===Etymology===
Verb “to finish; to be completed” > ''perfective aspect particle'' ({{lang|zh|了₁}}, weakened form) > ''change-of-state modal particle'' ({{lang|zh|了₂}}).

Two kinds of particle uses of {{lang|zh|了}} can be distinguished: the perfective aspect particle after verbs (conventionally written as {{lang|zh|了₁}}) and the sentence-final modal particle ({{lang|zh|了₂}}). It is generally accepted ({{zh-ref|Wu, 1998}}) that these two uses of {{lang|zh|了}} are derived from the concrete verb “to finish”. The grammaticalisation of this verb had become common in the [[Tang]] Dynasty, initially in the form of ‹verb + (object) + ''perfective'' {{lang|zh|了}}› to indicate the completion of an action.

The perfective particle subsequently underwent further grammaticalisation to become the sentence-final change-of-state modal particle; {{zh-ref|Liu (1985)}} has demonstrated that this last step may have involved the coalescence of sentence-final {{lang|zh|了}} with {{zh-l|*也}} in certain Mandarin dialects, as the pronunciations of {{lang|zh|了₁}} and {{lang|zh|了₂}} are distinct in these lects, with {{lang|zh|了₂}} rhyming with {{lang|zh|也}}.

This word is cognate with {{cog|th|แล้ว||to be finished; already; then, afterwards}}, {{cog|lo|ແລ້ວ||to finish; to be completed; ''perfective particle''}}, {{cog|vi|rồi||already}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{n-g|Used after a verb to indicate [[perfective aspect]] (action completion).}}
#: {{zh-x|我 吃 了 一 個 蘋果。|I '''ate''' an apple.}}
#* {{zh-x|他 在 ^北京 住 了 兩 年。|He live'''d''' in Beijing for two years.}}
# {{n-g|Used at the end of a sentence to indicate a change of state.}}
#: {{zh-x|他 是 大學生 了。|He '''has become''' a student / He is a student '''now'''.}}

=====Synonyms=====
{{zh-dial}}

=====Usage notes=====
* {{sense|perfective aspect particle}} Most of the time, {{lang|zh|了}} is translated by a [[past tense]]. But it can also indicate that one action is completed before another.
*: {{zh-x|你 吃 了 以後 叫 我。|Call me when you are done eating.}}
* {{sense|change of state particle}} When used as the ''change of state particle'', {{lang|zh|了}} can be translated by “[[now]]”, “[[already]]” or “not [[anymore]]”.
*: {{zh-x|我 會 說 中文 了。|I can speak Chinese '''now'''. (I couldn't before.)}}
*: {{zh-x|我 吃飯 了。|I've eaten ('''already''').}}
*: {{zh-x|沒有 紙 了。|There's no paper '''anymore'''.}}
* In a question, {{lang|zh|了}} is put before the particle {{zh-l|嗎}}.
